If you have revealed Gold Map Tiles the previous rounds, then higher level (Gold) Followers will be added to the market (gold, normal, gold, normal, ...)

player.status.poisoned.description:
Some of the Enemy Attacks had <style="poison">Poison</style> Modifier.

<style="poison">Poison</style> cannot be cured and will be added as <style="wound">Wounds</style> to your <style="status">Discard</style> pile at the Campfire.

The only way to avoid <style="poison">Poison</style> is to Block the Attack that caused it.
player.status.poisoned.name: <style="poison">Poisoned</style>
player.status.wounded.description: You have one or more Wounds in your Hand. Wounds can be Healed by generating Healing Effects then applying them to the individual Wounds in your hand. Wounds will clog your Hand and cannot be discarded until the end of the Day/Night cycle, unless another card effect allows it or in special locations on the map when exploring or when interacting with locals. This means you will be Drawing less Cards on each subsequent turn, until the Wounds are healed.
player.status.wounded.name: <style="wound">Wounded</style>
player.status.knocked_out.description:
You took <style="wound">Wounds</style> in your Hand more or equal than your <style="value">Maximum</style> Hand Size. This includes Wounds taken from playing Cards.

When <style="status">Knocked-out</style> you cannot play any more Cards for the rest of the Battle or Interaction, but you can still <style="status">Activate</style> your Blessings or Followers.

Wounds that were <style="status">already</style> in your Hand before the Interaction are <style="value">not counted</style> towards <style="status">Knocked-Out</style> status, only <style="status">newly acquired</style> <style="wound">Wounds</style> matter.
player.status.knocked_out.description.dy:
You took <style="value">{0}</style> <style="wound">Wounds</style> in your Hand this turn which is more or equal than your <style="value">Maximum</style> Hand Size of <style="value">{1}</style>. This includes Wounds taken from playing Cards.

When <style="status">Knocked-out</style> you cannot play any more Cards for the rest of the Battle or Interaction, but you can still <style="status">Activate</style> your Blessings or Followers.

Wounds that were <style="status">already</style> in your Hand before the Interaction are <style="value">not counted</style> towards <style="status">Knocked-Out</style> status, only <style="status">newly acquired</style> <style="wound">Wounds</style> matter.
player.status.knocked_out.description.sh: You are <style="status">Knocked-Out</style> and cannot use any Effect this phase.
player.status.knocked_out.name: <style="status">Knocked-Out</style>
player.status.paralyzed.description:
Some of the Enemy Attacks had <style="paralyze">Paralyzed</style> Modifier.

When <style="paralyze">Paralyzed</style> you are forced to <style="status">Discard</style> all your Cards (except <style="wound">Wounds</style>). You can still <style="status">Activate</style> your Followers or Blessings.

<style="paralyze">Paralysis</style> cannot be cured, only <style="status">avoided</style> by <style="status">Blocking</style> the Attack that caused it.
player.status.paralyzed.description.shor: You are <style="paralyze">Paralyzed</style> and cannot use any Effect this phase.
player.status.paralyzed.name: <style="paralyze">Paralyzed</style>
hand.panel.description:
This panel shows all your Ability Cards. Use and combine them wisely to defeat your foes.
You will acquire more during your Crusade as you level-up or train.
There is a maximum number of Cards that you can have at a time (<style="value">Max</style> Hand Size). You can <style="value">Hold more</style> than the maximum but you will not draw more Cards at the Campfire unless you are <style="value">below your maximum</style> Hand Size.
<style="wound">Wounds</style> also count towards your Hand Size and thus clog your hand until you <style="status">Heal</style> them or they are <style="status">Discarded</style> at the end of the Day/Night cycle.

environment.tooltip.content: This panel shows the environmental information about the arena you are fighting in, the time of day (which restricts the usable mana types) and the ambient mana you can draw from.
environment.tooltip.mana.content: This panel shows the mana that you can draw from this environment (and how many). Depending on time of day some mana might be unusable. Any mana that you have used will also be shown as inert.
